project3.lex
Class Token

java.lang.Object
  project3.three.Node
      project3.lex.Token
Direct Known Subclasses:
Argument
public class Token
extends Node

A lexical analyzer produces a list of tokens. This defines a token. A Token consists of a type, value, and lineNumber. We inherit from project3.Node so that we can add tokens to constant lists, attribute lists, or argument lists. 

 Domain:
      type       : TokenType
      value      : String
      lineNumber : int

 Instance Invariant:
      type ≠ null AND
      value ≠ null AND
      type = TokenType.EOF ⇒ value = ""
Last Modified: 2 Mar 2006

Version:
1.0
Author:
Scott N. Woodfield
See Also:

Field Detail

COMMA

public static final Token COMMA
The COMMA Token. Used when we need a comma token but don't care about the line number. This token is currently used in project3.three.NamedList.getSeparator() and in project3.PredeicateList.getSeparator().

See Also:
Source Code

type

protected TokenType type
The type of the token. Accessed by "getTokenType". It cannot be modified after the token has been created.

See Also:
Source Code

value

protected java.lang.String value
The value of the token. The sequence of characters from the input stream that were parsed to create this token. Some tokens with the same token type will always have the same value. For instance, tokens of type TokenType.SEMICOLON will always have the value ";". Other tokens, such as strings and identifiers can have different values. Tokens of type EOF will have the "" or empty string value.

See Also:
Source Code

lineNumber

protected int lineNumber
The line on which the first character of the token was found.

See Also:
Source Code
Constructor Detail

Token

private Token(TokenType type,
              java.lang.String value)
Constructs a token from a type and value. Used primarily to create constants.

Precondition: None
PostCondition: this.type = type
this.type = TokenType.EOF ⇒ this.value = ""
this.type ≠ TokenType.EOF ⇒ this.value = value
this.lineNumber = -1 		AND
AND
AND
 

Parameters:
type - the type of the token.
value - the value of the token.

this.type = TokenType.EOF ⇒ this.value = ""
this.type ≠ TokenType.EOF ⇒ this.value = value

Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
Compares two Tokens to see if they are equal. Notice that we only use the type and value to determine if two tokens are equal. We ignore the line number.

Precondition: none
PostCondition: result = object ≠ null
object instanceof Token
type = object.type
value = object.value 		AND
AND
AND
 

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
object - the object we are comparing this to
Returns:
true iff the objects are equal

checkConstructorPrecondition

protected void checkConstructorPrecondition(TokenType type,
                                            java.lang.String value,
                                            int lineNumber)
                                     throws ParserException
Checks the precondition of the non-copy constructors. Since we only check preconditions, the only purpose of this method is to throw an exception if an error is found. Otherwise it does nothing.

Precondition: type ≠ null
lineNumber >= 1
type ≠ TokenType.EOF ⇒ value ≠ null
type ≠ TokenType.EOF AND type ≠ TokenType.STRING ⇒ |value| > 0
type == TokenType.STRING ⇒ (isLetter(value[0])
∀i (0 <= i AND i < |value| ⇒ (isLetterOrDigit(value[i])))
type == TokenType.SCHEMES ⇒ value.equalsIgnoreCase( "Schemes")
type == TokenType.Facts ⇒ value.equalsIgnoreCase("Facts")
type == TokenType.Rules ⇒ value.equalsIgnoreCase("Rules")
type == TokenType.Rules ⇒ value.equalsIgnoreCase("Queries")
type == TokenType.COLON_DASH ⇒ value = ":-"
type == TokenType.COLON ⇒ value = ":"
type == TokenType.COMMA ⇒ value = ","
type == TokenType.PERIOD ⇒ value = "."
type == TokenType.LEFT_PAREN ⇒ value = "("
type == TokenType.RIGHT_PAREN⇒ value = ")"
type == TokenType.Q_MARK ⇒ value = "?"
lineNumber >= 1 		AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
AND
 
PostCondition: true

Parameters:
type - the token type to be checked.
value - the value of the new token.
lineNumber - the lineNumber of the new token
Throws:
ParserException
See Also:
Source Code

allTheRestMustBeLettersOrDigits

protected boolean allTheRestMustBeLettersOrDigits(java.lang.String value)
Returns true if value[1..|value|-1] are all letters or digits, otherwise it returns false.

Precondition: none
Postcondition: result = value ≠ null
∀i (0 < i AND i < |value| ⇒ isLetterOrDigit(str[i])) 		AND
 

Parameters:
value - the string to be inspected.
Returns:
whether or not all but the first character are letters and digits.
